contentList.content: Enables AI control with default class-appropriate archetype for all party members and summons within range.
Tactical melee combatant. Closes distance to enemies, prioritizes finishing wounded targets, uses area attacks when multiple enemies are clustered.
Tactical ranged combatant. Maintains distance from enemies, focuses on high-priority targets, uses tactical positioning for optimal shots.
Will prefer to finish turns closer to enemies if melee or further away if ranged, has preference to deal damage or finish off enemies.
Will prefer to finish turns closer to enemies if melee or further away if ranged, has less preference to deal damage and more to heal allies, will also secondarily prefer buffing allies.
Tactical spellcaster. Uses area spells on grouped enemies, prioritizes high-value targets, maintains safe distance, conserves spell slots for dangerous encounters.
Stealth specialist. Prioritizes sneak attacks and flanking positions, targets vulnerable enemies, uses cunning actions for mobility.

Will prefer to finish turns closer to enemies if melee or further away if ranged, has less preference to deal damage and more to applying statuses to enemies, will use 'Hold Person', 'Sleep', 'Command', more often.
Change AI state for active summons
This character is either drunk or controlled by an AI
Removes AI from all Companions and Summons
Random and unfiltered, they don't have any preferences, will do what they want
This character is currently focused on dodging
Attempt to create a mind-link with any friendly or neutral target and make them one of your most faithful allies
Under the influence of the caster's mind-controlling magic, this character fights on their side
Start or stop transmitting the intent to be followed through the mind-link you have established with your mind-controlled allies
An assortment of spells you can use to establish and influence those under your mind-link
Leverage your mind-link connection to manipulate the space around your mind-linked allies, enabling their instant teleportation to your location
Sever the mind-link, releasing your target and erasing their memories of the link, allowing them to return to their normal lives
The mind-link is very strong and the target is unwilling to let go
Currently transmitting to any mind-linked allies the intent to be followed
Extend the influence of your mind-link from simple loyalty to complete possession
This character is currently possessed. Can be cast again to stop possession
Turn a party member into an NPC which will allow for more spells and abilities to be used.
Becomes an NPC during combat and a player character outside of it
Has no melee or ranged preferences. Likes to deal damage, likes to use the environment such as barrels, likes to use poison and items, Likes to disarm opponents and sometimes even steal their weapons
Choose what archetype your Ally NPC will use. NPCs can use a larger variety of spells and actions. *Warning: Do not use Ally NPC on more than 3 characters at a time
Similar to the General Archetype, the character's actions will depend on the game's base archetype which means it can be quite random with no specific preferences
Teleport anyone under any of the AI Allies statuses to you
Random assortment of spells that may or may not be useful to you
Pick a target and your faction will change to theirs
Will revert you to your initial faction
This is your very own archetype and only you know what it truly does.
This is your very own archetype and only you know what it truly does.
This character is under your very own, superior archetype
Turns the target into an NPC. use cases would be if a character is somehow player controlled when they shouldn't be or you're experimenting
Makes the target player-controlled. use cases would be if you accidentally turned a character into an NPC or you're experimenting
No ranged/melee preferences, really likes to deal damage and also really likes throwing or using improvised weapons **Do NOT keep healing potions on this character, it does not work well yet**
Here you can find and apply any of your 4 custom archetypes.
Pick an order for your allies
Use a bonus action to mark a target for your allies as a priority, your allies will then proceed to bully this target for 3 turns.
This character is currently being bullied
Use a bonus action to mark a target for your allies as a low priority for 3 turns, your allies will try to do absolutely anything else but target this target unless there's nothing else to do.
Do not use this on Temporary Companions!
Prints the target's current archetype to the console
Won't actually change the archetype and instead use whatever archetype the game has assigned to this character and only turn the AI control on.
If this passive is toggled on, the character will become an NPC during combat. non-NPC if toggled off. Requires an Archetype to do anything.
Will make the target unable to cast spells. Target can still use weapons, weapon abilities and cantrips.
Will make the target unable to throw items.
Dynamic version of the block casting spell. Unlocks higher level spellslots the lower the character's health with lvl 6 spellslots unlocking at 50% health
Includes spells that allow you to assign friendly characters to any of the 4 swarm groups, any character that are in the same swarm group will play their turn at the same time.
Pick which targets you would like to be on the same group.

Use a bonus action to mark a target for your allies as a priority, your allies will then proceed to bully this target for 3 turns. Your allies will also get a roll bonus to attack of 1d4-1 against this target.

Use a bonus action to mark a target for your allies as a low priority for 3 turns, your allies will try to do absolutely anything else but target this target unless there's nothing else to do. Targets are afflicted with a -1d4+1 penalty to attack rolls against your allies.
